algorithm.bdy:
The Thalmann Algorithm (VVAL18) is a deterministic decompression model developed by Capt.
Edward D. Thalmann , M.D., USN, who did research into decompression theory at the Naval Medical Research Institute, Navy Experimental Diving Unit, the State University of New York at Buffalo and
Duke University . The algorithm forms the basis for the current U.S. Navy mixed gas and standard air dive tables.
Description
VVAL 18 is a deterministic model that utilizes the
Naval Medical Research Institute
Linear Exponential (NMRI LE1 PDA) data set for calculation of decompression schedules. Phase two testing of the US Navy Diving Computer produced an acceptable algorithm with an expected maximum incidence of decompression sickness less than 3.5% assuming that occurrence followed the binomial distribution at the 95% confidence level.
References
Thalmann, E. D.; I. P. B. Buckingham and W. H. Spaur. ( 1980). " Testing of decompression algorithms for use in the U.S. Navy underwater decompression computer (Phase I).". Navy Exp. Diving Unit Res. Report 11-80. Retrieved on 2008-03-16.
Thalmann, E. D. ( 1983). " Computer algorithms used in computing the MK15/16 constant 0.7 ATA oxygen partial pressure decompression tables.". Navy Exp. Diving Unit Res. Report 1-83. Retrieved on 2008-03-16.
Thalmann, E. D. ( 1984). " Phase II testing of decompression algorithms for use in the U.S. Navy underwater decompression computer.". Navy Exp. Diving Unit Res. Report 1-84. Retrieved on 2008-03-16.
Thalmann, E. D. ( 1985). " Development of a Decompression Algorithm for Constant Oxygen Partial Pressure in Helium Diving.". Navy Exp. Diving Unit Res. Report 1-85. Retrieved on 2008-03-16.
Thalmann, E. D. ( 1985). " Air-N202 Decompression Computer Algorithm Development.". Navy Exp. Diving Unit Res. Report 8-85. Retrieved on 2008-03-16.

Joint Report: Naval Submarine Medical Research Laboratory and Naval Medical Research Institute NSMRL 1182 and NMRI 92-85. Retrieved on 2008-03-16.
Parker, E. C.; S.S. Survanshi, P.K. Weathersby, and E.D. Thalmann. ( 1992). " Statistically Based Decompression Tables VIII: Linear Exponential Kinetics.". Naval Medical Research Institute Report 92-73. Retrieved on 2008-03-16.

Survanshi, S. S.; E. C. Parker, E. D. Thalmann, and P. K. Weathersby. ( 1997). "Statistically based decompression tables XII: Volume II. Repetitive dive tables: Air.". Naval Medical Research Institute Report 97-36.
Survanshi, S. S.; E. C. Parker, E. D. Thalmann, and P. K. Weathersby. ( 1997). "Statistically based decompression tables XII: Volume III. Exceptional exposure tables: Air.". Naval Medical Research Institute Report 97-36.
Survanshi, S. S.; E. C. Parker, E. D. Thalmann, and P. K. Weathersby. ( 1997). "Statistically based decompression tables XII: Volume IV. Repetitive dive tables: 0.7 ATA PO2 in N2.". Naval Medical Research Institute Report 97-36.
